sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A letter farther and more fully evidencing the Kings stedfastnesse in the Protestant religion, written by Mounsier de l'Angle minister of the Protestant church at Roven in France to a friend of his in London, L'Angle, Samuel de.
[4], 26 p.
printed by A.W. for Joshua Kirton at the Queens Arms in St. Pauls Church-Yard, London : 1660.
A variant has replaced the imprint word "Queens" with "Kings". Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 1". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A letter farther and more fully evidencing the Kings stedfastnesse in the Protestant religion, written by Mounsier de l'Angle minister of the Protestant church at Roven in France to a friend of his in London, L'Angle, Samuel de.
[4], 26 p.
printed by A.W. for Joshua Kirton at the Queens Arms in St. Pauls Church-Yard, London : 1660.
A variant has replaced the imprint word "Queens" with "Kings". Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 1". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Joshua Kirton
A.W.
the Queens Arms in St. Pauls Church-Yard
>>>>>>> imprintparse
